intro: Sphaerostephanos kalkmanii, commonly known as the Kalkman's star-fruit, is a rare and unique plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive, clustered inflorescences that resemble small stars, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by round, fleshy fruits resembling tiny oranges. Its botanical features include a woody stem and small, elliptical leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
